title: Double amount transferred (accounting error) on using crypt remote with azureblob
body:
#### The associated forum post URL from `https://forum.rclone.org`
https://forum.rclone.org/t/azureblob-exceeding-100-per-file-amount-transferred-is-double-the-amount-of-files/52102/1

#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?
Similar to [Percentages Exceeding 100%](https://forum.rclone.org/t/percentages-exceeding-100/51006) all my files exceed the 100% progress per file up to 200%. Furthermore, it uses double the amount transferred, so for 3 TiB of files it SHOWS 6 TiB of transferred. Real traffic seems to be half of that so the correct amount (not 100% sure on that) This happens on azureblob with the default block size of 4MiB and files of about 64MiB. This stops happening if I set chunk size to 128Mi. Also, setting chunk size to 128Mi (larger than any file in repo) significantly reduces transactions.


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone-v1.70.3


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)
linux 64bit


#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)
azureblob


#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
`./rclone-v1.70.3-linux-amd64/rclone sync --config /data/rclone.conf test/ crypt-test:testnewrcloneversion --delete-after --stats-log-level NOTICE --fast-list -vv`


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

#### How to use GitHub

* Please use the üëç [reaction](https://blog.github.com/2016-03-10-add-reactions-to-pull-requests-issues-and-comments/) to show that you are affected by the same issue.
